description: The only rewards platform that helps managers retain a financial stable workforce.
problem_statement: Managers are struggling to retain hourly workers that are productive, engaged, and motivated. It costs U.S. companies over a trillion dollars a year.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: We sell to VP of Total Rewards at large enterprises and Owner/Operators in mid-market franchises looking to reduce the costs incurred from high turnover and low productivity among their hourly workforce.
Market size: 300+ FTEs

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: 401ks don't work for hourly workers. Neither does the face value of giving a gift card or throwing a pizza party. We're the only platform that pays workers with real cash savings – 4% interest whenever an employee picks up a last minute shift, provides great customer service, celebrates a work anniversary, etc.
In-market since: Yes, 6 months

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: In 6 months, we've secured our bank partner, have users saving $1k in as little as 3 months, and in sales negotiations with clients from McDonald's to Shake Shack
Customers: We have 2 live customers and a sales pipeline of $800k
Pricing: 100% are paying at a $4 PEPM

ecosystem_signals.justification:
Program source: Referral
Referral: Colin Tobias

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: Micah Berman, co-founder and CTO, https://www.linkedin.com/in/micahberman/
Tech team: Our team is building the product internally. We're software alumni from Google and Walmart

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: Lack of critical feedback and market exposure with the right employers.
Successfully navigating the enterprise sales motion and how best to build partnerships with benefits brokers.

founder_profile.name: [Micah Berman](https://www.linkedin.com/in/micahberman/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment: When we started Ezra we weren't sure what would resonate more: the easiest way to financially secure your workforce or the easiest way to reduce turnover in real-time. Anthony Valletta, CEO of Bartaco, sits on our advisory board. He told us it was the latter. So we focused on large QSRs given high turnover rates within the industry, highlighted our SOC2 compliant software, and messages our solution as way for managers to keep their teams motivated, productive, and engaged. Within 3 months of implementing the feedback, McDonald's and Shake Shack came through on inbound with projected close by Q3'25.

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

gtm_support_potential.justification: Feedback from operators in sectors outside of quick service restaurants and manufacturing on our solution

category_comparison: Ezra positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.
